description: All schools in the canton Glarus, Switzerland moved to distance teaching from March 16, 2020 until April 4. That means that teachers are giving homework and excercises to students while staying at home. Parents are advised to care for their youngest kids. When kids are supervised in groups, the care takers are advised to only care kid in small groups. The communities of the canton have to provide free care for children in kindergartens and primary schools during usual class times during the day.

description:
On April 7, 2020 in Switzerland the government council of Canton Basel-City issued an ordinance on the assessment and school career decisions of elementary and secondary school students as well as the secondary school leaving certificate ("Matur") during the corona pandemic. Students are promoted to the next school year regardless of their grades. The calculation of the maturity grades is based on the assessment evidence during  classroom teaching and oral assessment evidence during distance learning.
This ordinance enter into force retroactively as of March 16, 2020. It shall apply until the end of the school year 2019/2020.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: From March 16, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced a closure of in-person lessons in all public and private obligatory and post-obligatory schools and universities. The lessons are announced to continue via yet unspecified online means. Exempt are children of essential workers during the pandemic, who will receive the same teaching activities. On April 17, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced the continuation of lessons in primary schools from May 11 and from June 8 in secondary and high schools, should the development of the virus allow it. UPDATE: On April 17, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced the continuation of lessons in primary schools from May 11 and from June 8 in secondary and high schools, shall the development of the virus allow it.

description:
The authorities of the canton Schaffhausen announced on March 13th, 2020 that there will be no on-site teaching in the schools in the canton Schaffhausen, from March 16th onwards. There should be no on-site teaching until April 4th. The Schools should move to online teaching, the authorities said. 

Secondary schools and higher education institutions are allowed to go back to on-site teaching on June 8th, 2020.

description:
On March 13, 2020 in Switzerland the State Council of Canton Valais announced the closure of all public and private schools, nurseries,  kindergartens, higher education institutions and vocational education institutions with immediate effect till April 30. Urgent childcare will be provided.
In addition to the already announced federal school closure starting March 16. UPDATE: On March 16 this policy was overruled by the Federal closure of schools, allowing cantons only to close childcare facilities if needed child care is provided.

description:
Switzerland "At an extraordinary meeting today, 16 March 2020, the  Federal Council took the decision to introduce more stringent measures to protect the public".
"The new Ordinance on Measures to fight the Coronavirus also clarifies the question of child day-care facilities. The cantons are required to ensure that childcare is provided for children who cannot be looked after privately. Child day-care facilities may only be closed if other suitable arrangements exist. This measure will apply for the time being until 19 April. School closures will also now apply until this date."
This ordinance comes into force March 17.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel ordered the closure of all schools, professional training centers, high schools, universities, "hautes écoles" (specialized higher education institutions) and extra-familial care centers (eg: day-care centers), from 16th March 2020 to 4th April 2020. A minimum extra-familial care service will be however provided on certain conditions to families who can't keep their children at home (conditions: parents work in healthcare or security and have no other child care option). On 16th March 2020, this policy was extended to 19th April 2020 by the federal Ordinance 2 of 16th March 2020, which took over all cantonal measures.
 UPDATE: The original closure of schools was set to last until 4th April 2020, but it has been extended to 19th April 2020.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 23, in Switzerland the Canton Jura announced that
- all schools (compulsory and post-compulsory) will remain closed till April 30, 2020. 
- Admission to childcare facilities is limited to children who cannot benefit from a private daycare solution.
Priority is given to the children of people mobilized in the fight against the coronavirus, and for children whose placement is ordered or recommended by the authorities or social services. UPDATE: The original closure of schools and children daycare was  set to last till April 4, it has been extendet to April 30.

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton of Zurich decided at the 19th of march that the exams from the 25th of march will be moved to a later date because of the big numbers of candidates the health measures can’t be met, that’s why the oral exams and the creative aptitude tests will not take place.  This leads to adjustments of the admission procedure in middle schools and specialized middle school for the school year 2020/2021. For the admission, the result of the written examination will be decisive for pupils, according to the applicable admission regulations would have to take the oral exam. These pupils will be provisional accepted to the probationary period. The design aptitude tests for the K + S classes and the Liceo artisto will be exclusively based on the handed in documents of the candidates.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On April 3, in Switzerland the Canton Jura announced an extended access to childcare facilities after April 6. 
In the absence of another private solution, parents working in the following areas can make requests: distribution of essential goods, bank, post office or even mobilization by civil protection or the army, provided that both spouses are active in these fields or that the request concerns a single-parent family .
 UPDATE: Originally all schools and childcare facilities were closed. Daycare was provided for children of medical and social staff. Now access to daycare is extended to children of parents working in essential business.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)

description:
On April 30 Ticino announced the reopening of compulsory schools as of May 11. However non-compulsory schools, i.e. high schools for children from 15-18 and higher education institutes, remain closed. 
Elementary school (age 6-12) reopen part-time (minimum of 4 half days or 2 full days) and reduced in number of students (maximum half of a section of 25 students). This also applies to kindergarten ( age 4-6), but attendance will be voluntary. As before emergency childcare is provided, but not extended.
For secondary schools, the return to class occurs fractionally. Each institution taking into account the number of its students and its particularities (transport, canteen etc.), will organize one partial presence of the classes in place for at least one day (or two half-days per week). Distance learning will be extended.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On April 30, 2020 the Department of Education in Swiss canton of Basel - City the announced that as of May 11, 2020, lessons for children will begin in kindergarten ( age 4-5), primary school (age 6-12) and lower secondary level ( age 12-15) according to the usual lesson times and the regular timetable in their classes.
According to the requirements of the Federal Office of Health (BAG), the distance rules between teachers  and students must be observed as far as possible.This is not necessary between the students themselves. Children day care facilities ( age 0 to 12) will open as well, but group size remains limited to 10 children. Remote learning will go on for post-obligatory education.

description:
On April 30, the Swiss canton of Obwalden announced that in accordance with federal guidelines, compulsory in-person education would resume with a hygiene concept on May 11. Restrictions include: Staff members must maintain social distancing (2m) from each other and students. Students from 5th grade and older are encouraged to practice social distancing outside the classroom, this does not apply to younger students. Hands must be washed upon entering school premises. Classrooms must be aired after every class, surfaces must be cleaned regularly. All school members are discouraged from sharing food, beverages, and dishes. All school members must be actively trained on these rules.

Written final exams take place normally, but without oral exams.

More tight restrictions apply to non-compulsory education, especially vocational training.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On May 1, the Swiss canton of Nidwalden specified its hygiene concept for the re-opening of compulsory schools permitted by the federal government beginning on May 11. The following measures are required: Hand washing is required upon entry to school premises and recommended when changing classrooms. Teachers must maintain social distancing whenever possible. School members with respiratory symptoms must not attend school. Gatherings of more than one class and sports with excessive body contact are discouraged. The use of separating plexiglass barriers is recommended.

description: "At its meeting on April 29, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided to further ease the measures introduced to protect the population against the coronavirus. From Monday, May 11 in schools of the upper secondary level (age above 16) and the tertiary level as well as other training facilities, classes involving up to five students, including music lessons can resume. Exams can be held, provided the rules on hygiene and social distancing are respected. Classes involving larger groups should be possible from 8 June."

description:
On May 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Fribourg announced that the pupils of the 1st and 2nd cycle ( age 4 to 12) will return to the compulsory schools on May 11th in half-classes, two days per weeks. Group A on Mondays and Thursdays,  group B on Tuesdays and Fridays. till May 25th.
For students of secondary I schools distance learning will continue. Private secondary schools may open according to their own order. Emergency childcare for school children will continue. Secondary II schools ( age 16 - 18 ) may resume in groups of 5 students. The policy was announced to last until the summer holidays, starting on July 6. 

 UPDATE: The policy was announced to last until the beginning of the holidays in the Fribourg province, starting on July 6.

institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel ordered the closure of all schools, professional training centers, high schools, universities, "hautes écoles" (specialized higher education institutions) and extra-familial care centers (eg: day-care centers), from 16th March 2020 to 4th April 2020. A minimum extra-familial care service will be however provided on certain conditions to families who can't keep their children at home (conditions: parents work in healthcare or security and have no other child care option). On 16th March 2020, this policy was extended to 19th April 2020 by the federal Ordinance 2 of 16th March 2020, which took over all cantonal measures. On 30th April 2020, the canton of Neuchâtel announced that in-person classes would resume in half-classes ("demi-classe") on 11th May 2020 for cycles 1 and 2 of compulsory schooling (1st to 8th year of education), thus ending the original policy.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
"At its meeting on April 29, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided to further ease the measures. From Monday, May 11 primary and lower secondary schools ( age 4 to 15) will be able to recommence classroom teaching. The FOPH and the Swiss Conference of Cantonal Directors of Education have drawn up requirements for the precautionary measures to be taken in consultation with the Science Taskforce and other experts. The cantons and communes have until 11 May to make arrangements for implementing these measures, taking account of local circumstances in each case. Schools will be allowed to be flexible in their approach to classroom teaching. Cantons to decide how classes will be taught. "
Covid 19 ordinance 2, Art. 5:  If there is no face-to-face teaching, the cantons will provide appropriate childcare for pupils. Children's day-care centers and other care offers must comply with the recommendations of the FOPH regarding hygiene and social distance.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

Parents of pupils requiring school care should get in contact with the school's principal office. UPDATE: In Appenzell-Ausserrhoden (Switzerland) obligatory schools may reopen on May 11. All students will be able to go to school. The only provision is the implementation of hygiene concepts.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

UPDATE: On April 17, 2020, the cantonal government of Schwyz announces that in accordance with federal regulations compulsory schools can reopen from May 11, 2020 onwards.

description: All schools in the canton Glarus moved to distance teaching from March 16, 2020 until April 4. That means that teachers are giving homework and excercises to students while staying at home. Parents are advised to care for their youngest kids. When kids are supervised in groups, the care takers are advised to only care kid in small groups. The communities of the canton have to provide free care for children in kindergartens and primary schools during usual class times during the day. UPDATE: Schools in Glarus reopen on May 11, in accordance with federal guidelines.
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In accordance to a federal decision, the Swiss canton of St. Gallen requires schools at all levels to begin distance learning with no face-to-face meetings. Daycare centers will be required to still operate to accommodate parents who must work. This will be valid from March 16-May 8. UPDATE: In accordance with the federal decision, pre-schools (age 4-5), primary schools (age 6-12) and lower secondary schools (age 13-15) are allowed to reopen starting May 11, 2020.

description:
On May 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Fribourg announced that
for students of secondary I schools (age 12 - 15) distance learning will continue till May 29. On May 28 and 29 ( Thursday and Friday) each school may decide to meet in reduced classes to prepare full school resumption after June 2.
Emergency childcare for school children will continue.
Private secondary schools may open according to their own guidelines. Secondary II schools ( age 16 - 18 ) may resume in groups of 5 students.

description:
On April 30, 2020 the State Council of Swiss Canton Vaud presented the measure taken by the cantonal Department of Education to reopen obligatory schools safely according to the framework guidelines of the Federal Office of Health and after having coordinated a return to class with the other French-speaking cantons.
Level 1P to 8P ( age 4 to 12) is scheduled to resume in full classes as of May 25.

for students of secondary I schools (age 12 - 15) distance learning will continue till May 29. On May 28 and 29 ( Thursday and Friday) each school may decide to meet in reduced classes to prepare full school resumption after June 2.

description: On 28th May 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel announced that all post-compulsory schools (equivalent of high school) would resume in-person classes under conditions from 8th June 2020 on. Conditions are the following: people within schools have to keep a distance of 2 meters at least apart from one another; classes can be separated into different groups depending on the number of students per classes and the number of square meters in each classroom. Exceptions can be made for vulnerable students and teachers, who will have the possibility to continue online classes.

description:
On May 26, 2020 the Departement of Education of the Swiss canton of Vaud presented its protection plan for the return of around 37,000 students and apprentices from Secondary II schools to class on June 8th ( age 16 and over) till summer break ( starting July 6th).
The spatial distance of 2 meters must be maintained between the students and between students and teachers.
The lessons take place in small groups, depending on the size of the rooms in square meters (1 person per 4 square meters).
Students will therefore come to school alternately every other day or every third day or respectively one week out of 2 or 3 for apprentices.
Homework is given for days without lessons. Only past year students who already received their title will not be required to return to class.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
On May 28, 2020 the Swiss Canton of Basel City announced that after the compulsory school (age 4-15) started classroom teaching on May 11, 2020, lessons will also start again at the vocational and upper secondary schools (age 15-18) from June 8, 2020. Social distancing (2m) must be maintained in the classroom. Depending on the spatial situation - there are different teaching models until summer break (June 26). At certain schools practically all students can attend face-to-face lessons, at others there is a mixture of face-to-face and distance learning.
Group size in childcare facilities is no longer restricted due to corona and school trips can resume as well.

institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
At its meeting on May 27, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided that  the measures put in place to fight the new coronavirus will be extensively eased. Classroom teaching at upper secondary ( age 16 and above) and at vocational schools and at higher education institutions will be allowed to resume from June 8th. 
Under what form the teaching resumes is a matter for the cantons or the educational institutions.Teaching can be organised flexibly and distance-learning can still be used. All educational institutions must develop and implement a protection concept.The responsible cantonal authorities ensure that the relevant requirements are implemented within the framework protection concepts established by the FOPH.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
institution_status: Secondary Schools allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On 30 April, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces the reopening of classrooms for middle and highschool students as well as vocational schools beginning on 8 June. Schools will reopen for half-time for two days, to begin. Students and faculty are set to follow hygiene precautions, social distancing measures. UPDATE: Originally, the middle schools and vocational schools and other secondary schools were supposed to reopen under a "mixed" policy as of June 8th. However, announced May 14th, there will be no face to face instruction for most students. Face to face instruction will only occur for those in need or with difficulty to the new format.

description:
On 30th April 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel announced its plan for the reopening of classes (for compulsory school, see records 8429061 and 1859975) but all post-compulsory schools (equivalent of high school) remain closed until further notice. Universities are to remain closed as well due to the absence of announcements regarding the resumption of classes. On 28th May 2020, the canton announced that in-person classes would resume under conditions in post-compulsory schools on 8th June 2020, thus ending this policy.

NB: there was no information on resumption of classes for universities, but one can consider the closure of universities ended as well because most (if not all) university calendars end in late May. UPDATE: The original closure of post-compulsory schools and universities didn't have an end date, but on 28th May 2020, the canton of Neuchâtel announced that in-person classes would resume under conditions in post-compulsory schools on 8th June 2020, thus ending this policy.

description: On May 28th, the the government of the Swiss Canton Solothurn announced that higher educational facilities (secondary level II), including vocational schools, would reopen on June 8th while adhering hygiene concepts. This includes permanent social distancing of 2m and the general calculation of 4 square metres per student in the classroms. Tele-teaching would still be offered, if needed. This policy effectively ended on August 9th with the introduction of a more comprehensive policy on the following day. UPDATE: The original policy was open-ended. This however, changed with the introduction of a new and more comprehensive policy, starting on August 10th which e.g. changed the social distance from 2 to 1.5m.

description: On 28th May 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel announced that all post-compulsory schools (equivalent of high school) would resume in-person classes under conditions from 8th June 2020 on. Conditions are the following: people within schools have to keep a distance of 2 meters at least apart from one another; classes can be separated into different groups depending on the number of students per classes and the number of square meters in each classroom. Exceptions can be made for vulnerable students and teachers, who will have the possibility to continue online classes. The academic year ended on 6th July 2020 at the start of the summer break, thus ending this policy. UPDATE: The original policy had no end date, but the academic year ended on 6th July 2020 at the start of the summer break. This automatically ended the policy.

description: On April 30th, the government of the Swiss Canton Solothurn announced that preschools, primary and secondary schools (secondary level I) would reopen under the condition that no external persons without explicit invitation would be allowed to enter the premises. This includes parents, external persons organizing/attending events and external organizations renting school rooms. The policy was scheduled to start on May 11th. On August 6th, 2020, the state government announced that from August 10th on, external organizations would be allowed to rent school rooms again outside of teaching time. UPDATE: The original policy banned external organizations from renting school rooms. This was changed to external organizations being allowed on school premises outside of teaching time.

description:
On August 18th 2020, the Swiss Canton of Vaud announced that it would start and resume school for the next school year under revised policies including but not limited to social distancing measures and population density as well as online learning.

Health protection plans have been drawn up around several scenarios that can be activated depending on the epidemiological evolution. The current situation allows for a resumption of classes starting on the 24th of August 2020. wearing a mask is becoming the new rule for all teachers, except during classroom time if they can maintain a distance of 1.5 meters. Wearing a mask also applies during lessons for post-compulsory students, as well as throughout the school perimeter.

description:
On August 18th 2020, the Swiss Canton of Vaud announced that it would start and resume school for the next school year under revised policies including but not limited to social distancing measures and population density as well as online learning.

Health protection plans have been drawn up around several scenarios that can be activated depending on the epidemiological evolution. The current situation allows for a resumption of classes starting on the 24th of August 2020. wearing a mask is becoming the new rule for all teachers, except during classroom time if they can maintain a distance of 1.5 meters. Wearing a mask also applies during lessons for post-compulsory students, as well as throughout the school perimeter.

description: On August 10, the Swiss Canton Ticino, announces the new measures for the re-opening of schools on August 31. In general, schools are foreseen to reopen with face to face classes. Masks will be optional for middle and post-compulsory students, for teachers, it will be optional during lessons and mandatory in the common areas. The common measures of hygiene and social distancing apply. In compulsory school, the distance of 1.5 meters between students is not indicated as necessary. The distance between the teacher and the students and between the adults present is important. In the post-compulsory school, where children are considered as adults, the distance must also be maintained between students. As for some disciplines such as physical education, there will be specific indications to avoid sports that involve frequent direct physical contact between students.

description: The education department of the Swiss Cantion Saint Gallen announced on October 30, 2020 that masks will be mandatory in high schools ("Oberstufe", age 16-18) starting from November 2,2020. In other schools masks are already mandatory, but there it was ordered by the federal government. The masks will be mandatory on the whole school ground and during classes. Also singing should be avoided. While so called contact sports like soccer or basketball are already prohibited by the federal government, the provincial education department now also orders that the physical education classes must be cut in half if it does not take place outside with social distancing measures. If a student had contact to a positive-tested person and couldn't keep the minimum distance or wear a mask he is also under quarantine.

description:
The Swiss Canton Grisons announced on January 11, 2021 that starting from January 12, 2021 10am all persons over 75 or with following chronic diseases:
• Heart failure and angina pectoris
• Therapy-resistant arterial hypertension
• Severe respiratory diseases
• Severe chronic renal failure
• Diabetes mellitus with organ damage, or poorly controlled diabetes mellitus
• Obesity (from BMI ≥35 kg / m²)
• Congenital or acquired immunodeficiency as well as immunosuppressive therapy (e.g. certain cancers under active therapy, severe HIV infection, organ transplantation)

can pre-register for the COVID-vaccination online or via phone. The registered persons will get their vaccination towards the end of January in one of the nine cantonal vaccination centers.
type_sub_cat: Administering of the vaccine (i.e. giving people the vaccine shot)

description: On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel-Landschaft has declared the State of Emergency.
On March 16,2020 in Switzerland Canton Valais declares an 'extraordinary situation' (aussergewähliche Situation).
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the council of Canton Vaud declares a situation of necessity within the territory of Canton Vaud according to Swiss Epidemics Act.
On March 16, 2020 the State Council of Swiss Canton of Geneva declares the state of emergency  (l'état de nécessité).

In Switzerland, the canton Aargau declares at the 16th or March the state of emergency. This includes the ban of public and private events, closed shops, markets, restaurants, bars, museums, leisure facilities, libraries, cinemas, theatres, concert halls, gyms and swimming halls as well as shops where people cant keep enough distance like hairdressers and make up studios. Supermarkets, take-aways, company canteens, delivery services for food, pharmacies, gas stations, train stations, banks, post offices, hotels, car repair shops, public administration and social facilities will stay open will stay open as long as they fulfil the distance and hygiene regulations. Hospitals, clinics and doctors surgeries will stay open but not preform not urgent treatment. People with high risk of getting infected will be on payed leave. Day cares will only be closed if other appropriate care exists.

description: Switzerland: On March 27, 2020 the Federal Council defines a new regionally limited "special risk situation" (besondere Gefährdungslage) and issues an ordinance (with reference to the Epidemics Act) that allows individual cantons to impose further restrictions on economic sectors to combat the epidemic, even during a national extraordinary situation and in coordination with the Federal Council. This applies retroactively from March 21,2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
on March 27, 2020 the Swiss federal council defines a new regional limited situation of 'special threat' (besondere Gefährdungslage) and issues an order ( refering to the Swiss Epidemics Act) to allow single cantons to take further measures on economic sectors in coordination with the federal council to fight the epidemie. This will apply backward after March 21,2020: ( to backward legalize Ticino policies).

 UPDATE: Originally Declaration of special situation, then declaration of extraordinary situation, now Definition and Application of a regional limited special situation of threat

description: On June 4, 2020 in Switzerland the Government of Canton Jura announced the end of the State of Emergency (état de nécessité) as of June 6, 2020. UPDATE: The State of Emergency was declared without ending, now it is ended as of June 6, 2020.

On Monday, March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the government council of Canton Uri held an extraordinary meeting  and decided on immediate measures in connection with protection against the coronavirus. It has determined the extraordinary situation for the entire canton of Uri in accordance with Article 2 of the Law on Civil Protection in the canton of Uri.
(announced March 17) UPDATE: On June 9th, 2020  the government council of Swiss canton Uri announced: Since March 16, 2020, the extraordinary situation in accordance with the cantonal civil protection law has applied in the canton of Uri due to the rapid spread of the coronavirus.In the canton of Uri there have been no new infections for weeks. As a result, the government council decided to return to normal in the canton of Uri on Friday, June 12, 2020

description: As of March 8, 2020, the airline SWISS first reduces its services to and from entire Zurich- and Geneva-based short- and medium-haul network and its long-haul routes to Tokyo, Osaka and Singapore. From March 23, 2020 onwards, the only long-haul destination served by SWISS is Newark and, from Zurich, the eight following European cities: London, Amsterdam, Berlin, Hamburg, Brussels, Dublin, Lisbon and Stockholm. For the time being, flights from Geneva to London, Athens, Lisbon and Porto will continue. Provisionally, there will be no further long-haul services from Geneva. Exceptions can be made for repatriation and for cargo-only flights. By June 15, 2020 and with the reopening of the Swiss border to Schengen states, the airline step-by-step resumes its normal flight schedule.

description: On March 11, Ticino closes 9 minor mountain passes on the Italian border, i.e. Pedrinate, Ponte Faloppia, Novazzano Marcetto, San Pietro di Stabio, Ligornetto Cantinetta, Arzo, Ponte Cremenaga, Cassinone, Indemini.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
The swiss federal council decided that from the 11th of March 2020 on Switzerland cross-border travelling from Italy to Switzerland will be limited to only a few borders crossings. The small border crossings will be closed and the border traffic will be channeled to the big border crossings. 

Following the closed border crossings -> alternative open border crossings

Pedrinate -> Chiasso strada (Ponte Chiasso)
Ponte Faloppia -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
Novazzano Marcetto -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
San Pietro di Stabio -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Ligornetto Cantinetta -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Arzo -> Stabio Gaggiolo or Brusino Arsizio
Ponte Cremenaga -> Fornasette or Ponte Tresa
Cassinone -> Fornasette
Indemini -> Dirinella (Zenna)

description: All external Swiss borders, including mountain passes in Ticino reopen on June 15 to Schengen members and the UK. This is in line with the federal decision. UPDATE: All Swiss external borders, including mountain passes in Ticino, open on June 15 to Schengen members and the UK.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 13th 2020, the Swiss Federal Council re-opens federal border checks including Schengen checks at the Italian border designed to limit incoming traffic from Italy to Switzerland. Only Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, people who only travel through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons are allowed to enter from Italy. Transit and goods traffic are still allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from Italy.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since the 9th of March 2020, the swiss border controls set up a monitoring system to monitor the effectiveness of the Italian measures. The border control (EZV) uses intensified sampling and checks that are carried out on a risk basis at the border to Italy. An example of such measures would be the checking of passports and work permits. UPDATE: Since the border to Italy was closed by Switzerland on March 13th, the monitoring measures ended.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 16, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council decides to successively close around 130 more small border crossings in coordination with the involved domestic and foreign partner authorities in Italy, France, Germany and Austria in order to ensure the effective control of the introduced border restrictions. This does not apply to the border to Liechtenstein and the closure does only affect people, not the transit and goods traffic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 11, Ticino closes 9 minor mountain passes on the Italian border, i.e. Pedrinate, Ponte Faloppia, Novazzano Marcetto, San Pietro di Stabio, Ligornetto Cantinetta, Arzo, Ponte Cremenaga, Cassinone, Indemini. On March 16 5 other minor mountain passes were added to the temporary closure, namely Arogno, Brusino, Pizzamiglio, Camedo e Fornasette. UPDATE: Additional to the already closed 9 mountain passes on March 11, as of March 16 five other minor mountain passes are closed, i.e. Arogno, Brusino, Pizzamiglio, Camedo e Fornasette.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
The swiss federal council decided that from the 11th of March 2020 on Switzerland cross-border travelling from Italy to Switzerland will be limited to only a few borders crossings. The small border crossings will be closed and the border traffic will be channeled to the big border crossings. 

Following the closed border crossings -> alternative open border crossings

Pedrinate -> Chiasso strada (Ponte Chiasso)
Ponte Faloppia -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
Novazzano Marcetto -> Novazzano Brusata (Bizzarone) or Chiasso strada
San Pietro di Stabio -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Ligornetto Cantinetta -> Stabio Gaggiolo
Arzo -> Stabio Gaggiolo or Brusino Arsizio
Ponte Cremenaga -> Fornasette or Ponte Tresa
Cassinone -> Fornasette
Indemini -> Dirinella (Zenna) UPDATE: From March 16, 2020 onwards, around 130 more small border crossings are closed successively after coordination with the involved domestic and foreign partner authorities. The target country is now not only Italy but also France, Germany and Austria.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From the 17 March 2020 onwards, the Swiss Federal Council extends the entrance ban introduced to Italy to France, Austria and Germany. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from these countries.

description: On March 13, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council announces that the air traffic from Germany, Austria, Spain, Italy and France will be channeled to the big airports in Zürich-Kloten, Genf-Cointrin and Basel-Mulhouse from March 19, 2020 onwards.

description:
Switzerland, Geneva--Beginning March 22 at 6 a.m. the canton will only have 8 open custom ports. 

"4 will be open 24 hours, each with a priority lane for badge holders: Anières
Bardonnex
Ferney-Voltaire
Thônex-Vallard

3 will be open for 24 hours without a priority lane: 
Moillesulaz
Perly
Meyrin

2 will only be open from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m.:
Mon-Idée
Veyrier"

"Les quatre douanes suivantes seront ouvertes 24 heures sur 24 et compteront chacune une voie prioritaire réservée aux détenteurs d'un macaron:
Anières
Bardonnex
Ferney-Voltaire
Thônex-Vallard
Les trois douanes suivantes seront ouvertes 24 heures sur 24 sans voie prioritaire:
Moillesulaz
Perly
Meyrin
Deux autres douanes seront ouvertes de 6 heures à 20 heures:
Mon-Idée
Veyrier"
target_geog_level: All countries

description: On March 16, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council announced its intention to mobilize up to a maximum of 8,000 military personnel to support the civil health service, the Federal Customs Administration and the cantonal police forces. description:

description: On May 11, the Swiss Federal Council relaxes the external border checks introduced to foreign travelers from all states except for Liechtenstein for foreign workers, family reunifications and students from France. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, people with a Swiss visa, family reunifications, students from France, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons as well as supporting health care workers. Foreign workers who applied for short-term employment and whose professional activity is necessary for the national well-being are allowed to enter Switzerland if either their application was submitted to the responsible cantonal authority before the border restrictions enacted on 25 March 2020 (European or EFTA states) or their application was approved prior to March 19 2020 but the border crossing was impossible because of the restriction on the approval of Visa or residence permits (non European/EFTA states). Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter.

description: On March 25, the Swiss Federal Council extends the external border checks introduced to Germany, Austria, Italy, France, Spain and all non-Schengen states to foreign travelers from all Schengen states except for Liechtenstein and all other states. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons as well as supporting health care workers. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter from these countries. UPDATE: The original external border restriction was mandatory for all states except for Liechtenstein. On May 11, this restriction was relaxed for foreign workers, family reunifications, and students from France.

description: In an agreement of May 15, 2020 with Germany and Austria, the Swiss Federal Department of Justice and Police allows people who wish to visit their partners or relatives or participate in important family events to cross the Swiss border using a self-declaration form. The same applies to owners of properties and gardens used by themselves as well as of agricultural, hunting or forestry land. Persons who have to care for animals may also enter.

description: Since June 3, the Federal Department of the Interior (EDI) may, after consultation with the Federal Department of Justice and Police (EJPD) and the Federal Department of Finance (EFD), impose border sanitation measures, such as temperature measurements, health questionnaires or quarantine measures, on people who intend to enter Switzerland from a risk country or region.

description: On June 8, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council relaxes the external border checks introduced to foreign travelers from all states except for Liechtenstein for partners of Swiss residents and foreigners in education and training. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, family reunifications, partners of Swiss residents (e.g. to prepare for marriage), students from France, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons such as foreigns attending education and training >90 days as well as supporting health care workers. Foreign workers who applied for short-term employment and whose professional activity is necessary for the national well-being are allowed to enter Switzerland if either their application was submitted to the responsible cantonal authority before the border restrictions enacted on 25 March 2020 (European or EFTA states) or their application was approved prior to March 19 2020 but the border crossing was impossible because of the restriction on the approval of Visa or residence permits (non European/EFTA states). Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter.

description: On June 15, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council reopens the Swiss border to all Schengen states. External border checks remain in place for all states outside the Schengen agreement. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, family reunifications, partners of Swiss residents (e.g. to prepare for marriage), people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons such as foreigns attending education and training >90 days as well as supporting health care workers. Foreign workers from non European/EFTA states who applied for short-term employment and whose professional activity is necessary for the national well-being are allowed to enter Switzerland if their application was approved prior to March 19, 2020 but the border crossing was impossible because of the restriction on the approval of Visas. Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter.

description: In an agreement of May 15, 2020 with Germany and Austria, the Swiss Federal Department of Justice and Police allows people who wish to visit their partners or relatives or participate in important family events to cross the Swiss border using a self-declaration form. The same applies to owners of properties and gardens used by themselves as well as of agricultural, hunting or forestry land. Persons who have to care for animals may also enter. UPDATE: The agreement of May 15, 2020 between Switzerland, Austria and Germany for partners, relatives and property owners is no longer in force since Switzerland has reopened the borders to Schengen states on June 15, 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From April 17 onwards, the Swiss federal council is putting a fine of CHF 100 on border crossings of Swiss residents for shopping tourism in France, Italy, Liechtenstein, Austria, and Germany to prevent the obstruction of the work of the border control authority. UPDATE: With the re-opening of Schengen and Efta states' borders on June 15, 2020, shopping tourism is allowed again.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Since June 3, the Federal Department of the Interior (EDI) may, after consultation with the Federal Department of Justice and Police (EJPD) and the Federal Department of Finance (EFD), impose border sanitation measures, such as temperature measurements, health questionnaires or quarantine measures, on people who intend to enter Switzerland from a risk country or region. UPDATE: The border sanitation measures introduced on June 3 to people entering Switzerland from a risk country/region no longer apply to Schengen states since June 15.

description: On June 8, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council relaxes the external border checks introduced to foreign travelers from all states except for Liechtenstein for partners of Swiss residents and foreigners in education and training. Entrance remains allowed for Swiss citizens, people with a residence permit in Switzerland, family reunifications, partners of Swiss residents (e.g. to prepare for marriage), students from France, people traveling through Switzerland, and people who have to travel to Switzerland for professional reasons such as foreigns attending education and training >90 days as well as supporting health care workers. Foreign workers who applied for short-term employment and whose professional activity is necessary for the national well-being are allowed to enter Switzerland if either their application was submitted to the responsible cantonal authority before the border restrictions enacted on 25 March 2020 (European or EFTA states) or their application was approved prior to March 19 2020 but the border crossing was impossible because of the restriction on the approval of Visa or residence permits (non European/EFTA states). Transit and goods traffic are also allowed. Finally, people in a situation of absolute necessity may also enter. UPDATE: On June 15, the external border restrictions no longer apply to states under the Schengen and Efta agreement.

description: On March 16, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council decides to successively close around 130 more small border crossings in coordination with the involved domestic and foreign partner authorities in Italy, France, Germany and Austria in order to ensure the effective control of the introduced border restrictions. This does not apply to the border to Liechtenstein and the closure does only affect people, not the transit and goods traffic. UPDATE: From June 15, 2020 onwards, the Federal Customs Administration announces that all border crossings at the Swiss land border are open again.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On June 15, the Federal Department of Health declares the continuation of border sanitation measures like temperature measurements and COVID-19 tests for people entering Switzerland from a country outside the Schengen agreement or a Schengen country with high numbers of COVID-19 cases, in particular Sweden. UPDATE: The border sanitation measures are annulled and replaced by a quarantine regulation for people entering Switzerland from a risk country introduced on July 2 2020.

description: On 6 July 2020, the Swiss Federal Council ensures that foreigners who have been prevented from taking action to grant family reunifications or residence permits in due time due to measures related to the coronavirus may make up for missed deadlines without negative consequences. This also applies to the deadlines for the renewal of biometric data for the issuance or extension of a permit.

description: Switzerland: From January 27, 2020, doctors and laboratories will have to report cases of suspected corona infection to the cantons and the federal government within two hours, as FOPH media spokesman Jonas Montani confirmed in a report by "Sonntagsblick" to the Keystone-SDA news agency.

description:
On its press conference on February 25, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health informed about the first person in Switzerland confirmed as being infected with the new coronavirus 2019-nCoV. People in close contact with the individual are being notified and placed in quarantine and their condition will be monitored over the next 14 days. On its webside ( February 16) the FOPH informed:" Should there be cases, the sick people would be isolated. Close Contact persons would have to be in quarantine for two weeks." On the webside for health professionals ( Feb 17) the term close contact is specified:
Contact from less than 2 meters and for more than 15 minutes. People who live in the same household. Care or medical examination without protective gear. Direct contact with body fluids. The cantonal departements of Health (Kantonsarzt) are responsible for tracing contact persons and monitoring their condition.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The Swiss Canton Grisons implements contact tracing with the first confirmed cases on February 27. It is not announced as official policy but since that moment systematically used and implemented.

It warned against calling and going to the Emergency Services of the Jura hospitals.

description: Since the first case was confirmed in Canton Zug on 3 March, contact tracing has been a fundamental part of the control measures. This will be a key strategy for the future, too. UPDATE: Due to the decrease in new infections with the coronavirus, contact tracing is to be carried out again consistently throughout Switzerland. The Canton of Zug, in cooperation with the Lung League of Central Switzerland, has already established daily contact with all infected persons and the close contact persons and will intensify these efforts. Comprehensive contact tracing is a recognised means of identifying and interrupting chains of infection.

description:

NB: as a reminder, the triage centers decide whether suspect patients should be sent to the hospital or back home, and if they should get tested or not.

Their goal is to capture the impact of the Corona crisis on society as broadly as possible. Among others, data on mobile phone movement of volunteers is published, usually collected on a daily basis.

description:
Switzerland, Geneva--The canton of Geneva, in relationship with the Directorate of General Health, announced April 1 that they have developed at 3 tier patient contact and monitoring system. The three-part system is comprised of CoviCall, CoviCheck, and CoviCare. 

CoviCall is for symptomatic individuals to get direction on whether to stay home, go see a doctor, go to a sampling/monitoring site, or go to the hospital.
CoviCheck centralizes all the positive results transmitted by the laboratories.
CoviCare is an outpatient monitoring network for suspected and confirmed cases.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
In Switzerland, in the canton Aargau the Cantonal Medical Service of Aargau offers from the 11th of May on a comprehensive service package to people who have recently become infected with COVID-19. These people will be contacted, advised and instructed individually. This service is provided by a new competence and coordination center of the cantonal medical service, the CONTI.

The exchange of information and data takes place primarily by telephone. Patients and healthcare institutions such as doctors or test laboratories can also enter their data electronically using an appropriate secure web form

description:
On May 11, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces that a team from the Health Department, supported by medical professionals and members of civil protection, resumed work on contact tracing. The aim is to interrupt the chain of infection by recording the sick and their contact persons and putting them in isolation (sick) or quarantine (contact). The COVID Care Team of the Graubünden Health Department accompanies the affected people during this time. 

The Swiss Canton Grisons never officially announced contact tracing as policy. However, since the first confirmed cases, it was systematically implemented and used. After around two weeks this was not possible anymore and the "extraordinary" situation and respective measures were implemented on March 13. UPDATE: The Swiss Canton Grisons never officially announced contact tracing as policy. However, since the first confirmed cases, it was systematically implemented and used. Since the beginning of March (roughly March 8) this was not possible anymore and the "extraordinary" situation and respective measures were implemented on March 13. On May 11, contact tracing and the piloting of an app was officially announced in line with federal requirements regarding the re-opening.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Valais (Switzerland) announces on May 14, that 4 people are conducting 7 to 10 contact tracing investigations a day. If necessary, the personal capacity can be increased to 20 people.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On May 8, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council announced to issue a temporary ordinance (amended May 14) for the pilot phase of a mobile application (proximity tracing app) that informs its users when they have been around infected people for too long. 
The app is expected to be tested by employees of the Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology in Lausanne and Zurich, by members of the armed forces and employees of hospitals as well as the federal and cantonal administrations. 
The parliament decided this week (May 5) that a legal basis must be created before the launch of the App. To this end, the Federal Council will amend the Epidemics Act accordingly and submit an urgent message to be adopted by parliament
The app is designed to help break chains of infection. With the app, potentially infected people can be warned at an early stage and the spread of the virus can be contained without compromising their privacy. Use of the app is voluntary. No personal data or location details of the app users are used. All data in the app are continuously deleted after 21 days. The app should only be used in the containment phase.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice,Military,Provincial/State Government

description:
At its meeting on June 24th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adopted the Ordinance on the Proximity Tracing System for the Coronavirus. 
This means that the SwissCovid app can be used throughout Switzerland from June 25th.
The Federal Council recommends that the public use the app, which complements classic contact tracing. 
If an app user has been in close contact with one or more infected individuals, they receive a message telling them that they may be infected with the new coronavirus. They are also notified of the day on which the contact took place along with details of the FOPH Infoline that they can call free of charge to obtain advice.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice

description: On June 30th, the Jura canton in Switzerland recommended its residents to download the contact-tracing app "SwissCovid'. This recommendation follows an emergence of positive cases in the canton.

description:
In Switzerland the state of emergency ended at the 19th of June, since then the the crisis management is carried out by the the cantonal medical service responsible in accordance with the Epidemics Act or the Department of Health and Social Affairs. They will adopt and implement the cantonal instructions and measures necessary to prevent further virus spread. As a first step, the canton of Aargau will introduce an ID for bar and club visits from Friday, July 3, 2020, 6 p.m.
For this purpose, the canton of Aargau is introducing an ID requirement for visits to bars and clubs. The general decree will come into effect on Friday, July 3, 2020, at 6 p.m.
The identification requirement applies to bar and club businesses. Restoration companies with a bar area and few standing places are excluded. The identification requirement ensures that identity is verified by obliging bar and club operators to compare the entries with a reliable official ID (passport, identity card or driver's license) when maintaining the presence list.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: From July 6, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg is requiring all arriving passengers from listed 'risk areas' to register with the cantonal authorities within 2 days from the arrival in order to monitor the compliance with the federal quarantine requirements.
target_geog_level: One or more regional groupings

description: In accordance with federal guidelines, the Swiss canton of Glarus imposed contact tracing requirements upon establishments (and events) such as restaurants, clubs, and bars, effective from July 20. These rules apply if no social distancing (min. 1.5m distance or masks) can be maintained. Establishments must collect contact information from every single guest and verify their accuracy (by means such as ID checks or calls to provided phone numbers), as well as store them electronically, ordered by dates. Data must be provided to cantonal health authorities within 2 hours upon request, and a contact person must be available for this purpose daily between 8 AM and 8 PM. Violations on purpose are subject to fines up to 10,000 CHF (up to 5000 CHF for violations by negligence).
type_sub_cat: Who a person has come into contact with over time
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

The app has been active since June 20 with certain venues, but following July 23 the app will be extended to all members of the Grand conseil de la nuit.

description: On February 28, 2020 in Switzerland In order to meet the increased demand for disinfectants, the joint notification office for chemicals of the Federal Office of Public Health, the Federal Office for the Environment and the State Secretariat for Economic Affairs has issued a temporary exceptional authorization for alcohol-based disinfectants (ethanol, propanol). This means that alcohol-based disinfectants may be sold, imported or manufactured without approval, provided they comply with the requirements. The general decree is valid until 31.08.2020. Remaining stocks may be sold after September 1 till Feb. 28, 2021.

description: Switzerland: The Health Department of Basel-City offered cross-border commuters working in the health sector overnight stays in Basel hotels. The offer started at the beginning of March 2020 and has now been discontinued as of the end of May 2020, as announced on June 15, 2020. This became necessary after the borders with Germany and France were closed, making it temporarily difficult for cross-border commuters to cross the border. In order to ensure the readiness of hospitals and nursing homes at the height of the Corona crisis, it became necessary to make the offer available to healthcare facility staff very quickly. On behalf of and at the expense of the canton, several Basel hotels provided around 1,500 overnight accommodations for health professionals with cross-border status.

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Médecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals.

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Médecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 12th March 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) in the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel decided to cancel all non-essential elective surgeries from 13th March 2020 on. The measure will be effective until further notice and during the whole peak period of the epidemic. The policy overall aims at making more resources available (hospital staff, hospital beds) to welcome Covid-19 patients.

description:
In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that from the 1st of April on additional health workers have to be hired because the outbreak of COVID-19 shows that the cantonal medical service is only able to handle smaller, local exposures but it is not set up for large, nationwide events.
The detailed list is:

-	1.0 positions senior physician, (wage class 22) 
-	1.8 positions Research Associate, (wage class 20) 
-	0.5 positions as an assistant doctor, (wage class 19) 
-	1.0 position administrative secretary, (wage class 12) 

This is a total job increase of 4.3
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In Switzerland, the state council of the canton Zurich decided that the cantonal pharmacy of Zurich is authorized to perform the service contract with Post CH AG. This is based on the fact that the current measures are not suitable for the continuous operation with its expected handling volumes and frequencies of more than 100 orders per day. Therefore, to provide the needed supply to around 6000 health care institutions (hospitals, medical practices etc.) in the canton of Zurich with protective material it is necessary to find as fast as possible a new warehouse and delivery logistics with an external logistics service provider being constructed
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In Switzerland, in the canton Zurich the medical association organizes on behalf of the health department of the Canton of Zurich (AGZ) the medical emergency service. It operates to do so with its subsidiary AGZ Support AG through the canton and the municipalities financed triage centre, which can be reached 24/7 via the emergency number 0800 33 66 55 is. This triage centre comes to ensure orderly care and triage of patients in the event of a pandemic and plays an important role for the greatest possible relief of the emergency departments of hospitals because it is the first point of contact for the residents when symptoms of COVID-19 appear. The triage centre is located in Zurich Oerlikon. It is set up to deal with a high load of calls through 12 additional external employees that answer these calls in home office. To be prepared for the worst case scenario of a severely restricted accessibility of the triage centre for the employees or a larger amount of sick employees additional 25 home office jobs will be created.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 27th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health announced that with the help of Swisscom’s analyses and visualisations, it is assessing whether the ban on gathering of more than five people in public ( by the Federal Council as of March 21st) is being respected. At no point location data from Swisscom are provided, merely analyses and visualisations. The data on which the analyses are based are anonymised and aggregated. It is not possible to make inferences about specific individuals. As soon as COVID-19 Ordinance 2 is abrogated, the Federal Office will not be provided with any further analyses.

description: On 27th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel opened a website called "Gardons le Cap" in collaboration with the Canton of Jura. This website aims at indexing all resources available to the population so as to cope with isolation and take care of one's health - both physical and mental. It also includes a list of Covid-related volunteering opportunities in Neuchâtel and Jura for those who either seek help or want to help.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On March 16, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council announced its intention to mobilize up to a maximum of 8,000 military personnel to support the civil health service, the Federal Customs Administration and the cantonal police forces. This support includes medical services, logistical tasks such as transportation and assistance in building improvisational infrastructure, and protection assistance at national borders and airports. UPDATE: The support of military staff to enforce the external border restrictions was first put into action on March 27, 2020 following the total closure of the Swiss borders.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On April 2, Ticino decided to lift the insurance suspensions for defaulters of health insurance in order to allow universal access to health care. 
This temporary provision ensures that the necessary care is in any case taken over by the health insurance companies.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau decided at the 1st of April that from the 2nd of April on the hospitals are exempted from certain regulations within the scope of fulfilling the special regulation (SonderV 20-1).

To authorize the hospitals for treatment regardless of the hospital list § 8 para. 3 of the ordinance on the hospital list about the barriers and the spectrum of the service orders placed on the hospital list is suspended
Irrespective of the performance mandate, hospitals are authorized to treat patients within their medical area of competence. 
Treatments that are performed outside an assigned performance mandate and within the medical competence area are to be billed based on the Aargau tariff specified by the Department of Health and Social Affairs (DGS) in a specific case. The approved Aargau tariff for early rehabilitation is to be applied for the convalescence departments to be created by rehabilitation clinics.
Based on Section 7 (4) of the hospital list, the Department of Health and Social Affairs can also issue hospitals that do not fulfill the requirements of Section 2 (2) of the hospital list as well as the procedure, the documents and the procedure in accordance with Section 3–5 hospital list. 

To authorize inpatient care facilities to create bed capacity § 13 para. 1 letter b and para. 2 of the Nursing Ordinance (PflV) is suspended.
The § 4 para. 2 letter b of the Care Act (PflG), the guideline value for the proof of need is suspended.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the Department of health and social affairs decided that from the 6th of April on the empty asylum seekers home at the maintenance area Frick that got closed will be used as an isolation ward for maximum 50 people. The cantonal social service, the Securitas AG, medical staff and civil defence will be in action and offer support. People with light symptoms or suspected cases will be accommodated there. Security and meals will be warranted.

description: On April 7, in cooperation with other Swiss Cantons and hospitals, the Canton of Fribourg received purchased health resources from China to support its COVID-19 response for hospitals, care homes, care at home, ambulances, and other health institutions. description: On April 9, 2020 in Switzerland the joint notification office for chemicals of the Federal Office of Public Health, the Federal Office for the Environment and the State Secretariat for Economic Affairs has issued a temporary exceptional authorization for chlorine-based surface-disinfectants. This means that disinfectants may be sold, imported or manufactured without approval, provided they comply with the requirements. The general decree is valid until 31.08.2020. Remaining stocks may be sold after September 1 till Feb. 28, 2021.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: The canton of Bern, Switzerland, has increased its capacity of hospital beds by 3,400 to prepare for COVID19 infections.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 13th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel created 7 triage centers to sort suspect patients depending on the seriousness of their symptoms, and decide whether or not they should get tested. Based on several health checks conducted at the centers (fever checks, blood pressure, oxygen saturation tests...), patients are either sent to the hospital or back home. An 8th center managed by Médecins du Monde has also been created to welcome undocumented immigrants and asylum seekers. A telephone line has been opened to book appointments at the centers. This policy overall aims at relieving the congestion in hospitals. On 15th April 2020, the canton of Neuchâtel reduced the number of triage centers from 8 to 5 in order to match the demand and the resources. UPDATE: The original policy featured 7 triage centers to sort Covid-19 suspect patients, but on 15th April 2020, they were reduced to 5 centers.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On April 16, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces to coordinate the organization of low-cost accommodation for workers from Italy with the affected communities in the regions of Bernina, Maloja and Engiadina Bassa / Val Müstair and sets up a hotline for cross-border commuters.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau the Federal Department of Home Affairs decided that from the 16th of April on the daily flat rate in convalescence departments in the rehabilitation clinics for covid-19 is CHF 913.

The canton Aargau offers people with low income a premium reduction for their health insurance premiums
If their financial situation gets worse there will be the possibility for more than 6 months to get an extraordinary adjustment for their premium reduction. This would be the case if the income decreased by at least 20%. Also, the senior civil servant decided that the waiting period of 6 months for the premium reduction will be abrogated.

For all persons who are currently on the list of defaulting insured persons, the postponement of benefits will be suspended from now until the extraordinary situation has ended.

The use of the mobile PalliativeSidelx enables COVID-19 patients in retirement homes without specialization for extreme palliative situations to be accompanied, fearless and dignified in the familiar environment.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In Switzerland, the canton Aargau launches from the 20th of April as a preventive measure a cooperation with the swiss red cross an intensive course of studies for nursing assistants that is based on three weeks (120h) intensive courses. After finishing the course there will be a practical use of minimum 8 weeks (320h) in a retirement home, home care or in an acute-care hospital.

description:
In Switzerland, the canton Aargau gifted from the 24th to the 27th of April in total 280’000 masks to around 19000 reopened businesses. Masks were handed out in the cities Baden, Frick, Kölliken und Wohlen
The cantonal police of Aargau, the with the industrial and trade supervision of the office for economy and labor as well as the office for consumer protection started first checks of businesses. These checks showed that businesses own a safety concept and that they are ready to implement the guidelines by the federal office of public health.

If the controlling bodies find slight deficits they will take care of them on site. They inform and sensitize the employees and the business about the protective measures and guidelines.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
target_city: Valposchiavo; Engiadina Bassa; Samedan; St. Moritz

description: On 22nd March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel announced that the military would provide assistance in the 2 Neuchâtel hospitals from 23rd March on by making 90 soldiers and 4 ventilators available to the canton. The soldiers will take charge of basic care to allow civil medical professionals to focus on more important treatments and Covid-19 cases. On 24th April 2020, the canton announced that the military would withdraw in the evening from the cantonal hospitals, now that the peak period of the epidemic was over. The canton specified that the soldiers could be called back within 24 hours and deployed within 72 hours if the situation worsened again. UPDATE: The original mobilization of the military in the Neuchâtel hospitals had no end date, but on 24th April 2020, the canton announced that the army would withdraw from the hospitals in the evening of the same day.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: Switzerland, canton Glarus  Hospital Treatments are postponed, March 17 2020. All non urgent hospital treatments and outpatient appointments are postponed. From April 27, the hospital is allowed to conduct non-urgent treatments. UPDATE: From April 27, the hospital is allowed to conduct non-urgent treatments.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 12th March 2020, the RHNe (hospital network) in the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel decided to cancel all non-essential elective surgeries from 13th March 2020 on. The measure will be effective until further notice and during the whole peak period of the epidemic. The policy overall aims at making more resources available (hospital staff, hospital beds) to welcome Covid-19 patients. On 23rd April 2020, the RHNe announced that it would resume non-essential elective surgeries on 27th April 2020, thus ending the original policy. UPDATE: The original cancellation of non-essential elective surgeries didn't have an end date; but on 23rd April 2020, the RHNe (hospital network of Neuchâtel) announced that it would resume elective surgeries on 27th April 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
From April 2 onwards, the Swiss federal costoms administration builds up so-called "Green Lanes" at some crossings of the Swiss border to optimize and speed up the import of important goods for the maintenance of the national economic supply as well as the enterance of priority professional groups, especially those working in the health sector. UPDATE: Since April 29, the following border crossings have "Green Lanes": 
Basel/Weil am Rhein-Autobahn; Rheinfelden-Autobahn; Basel/St. Louis-Autobahn; Kreuzlingen; Neuhausen am Rheinfall; Rafz / Solgen; Ramsen; Thayngen; Au; Schaanwald; St. Margrethen; Mendrisiotto SD Confine (Stabio)
target_geog_level: All countries
