description: On 26 February, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that persons without symptoms may be allowed to partake in a 14-day quarantine at home.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On February 26, 2020 the Swiss Federal Offiec of Public Health informed on its website: "If you have recently spent time in an area affected by the coronavirus. For 14 days after your departure:    If you have difficulties breathing, a cough or fever, stay at home or in your hotel. Do not go out in public. Immediately contact – first by phone – a doctor or health centre. Mention that you have recently been in an area affected by the coronavirus and have symptoms." Travelers and commuters from Italy are informed at the borders what to do if they have symptoms (difficulty breathing, cough or fever).People arriving at the airports are also informed.
affected areas are currently: China, Iran, Southkorea, Singapore, and in Italy the provinces Lombardy, Piemont and Venetia.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: On February 4, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health recommended on its webside to all persons having returned from China within the last 14 days: If you develop symptoms of a respiratory tract infection (fever, cough, shortness of breath)  stay at home, do not go out in public and contact a doctor immediately, by telephone first. UPDATE: On February 26 the recommandation was extended to travellers who have been in an affected area: China, Iran, South Korea, Singapore, and the Italian regions Lombardy, Piemont, Venetia.

description: Feb 27,2020 Swiss Canton Basel City is closing one children day-care facility and sending 75 families in a 14 day- quarantine
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description:
On 1 March, the Canton of Bern, Switzerland, announced that children should not attend school if:
- they have visited an area hit by Corona and were in close contact with someone who has Corona,
- if they have returned from an area hit by Corona in the last 14 days and have symptoms of coughing, breathing problems, and fever,
- if they have a fever.
type_text: Children are not to attend school under certain conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On February 28, the Swiss Canton Ticino advises all parents to keep children with flu symptoms (fever, cough, cold) at home with the reopening of schools as of March 2.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
The Swiss Federal Office of Public Health informed on its webside for health professionals ( February 17, 2020) that suspected cases (meeting the test criteria) and persons who tested positive for the coronavirus have to be isolated. The cantonal departements of health decide if the person is to be isolated at home or its hotelroom or is transferred to a hospital isolation ward. 
According to some newspapers and cantonal websides the people who tested positive had to be isolated in isolation wards of hospitals. UPDATE: On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new guidelines for dealing with symptomatic persons and their contacts from March 9, 2020 .
At its press conference (March 6), the federal government admitted that it was no longer possible to isolate all positively tested people in hospitals.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines for dealing with confirmed cases from March 9, 2020 and an information sheet (March 7): What to do if you are infected with the new Coronavirus.
confirmed cases are isolated:
 • At home, if the general condition permits (self-isolation)
Removal of isolation: 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the onset of symptoms
 • In severe cases in the hospital:
 Return home as soon as the clinical condition permits, or removal of isolation in the hospital in accordance with the criteria listed above.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines ( valid from March 9th) for persons who had close contact with someone who tested positive for the coronavirus.
Hospital doctors and doctors in private practice instruct the close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) of the confirmed cases to stay at home for 5 days after the onset of symptoms (of the confirmed case) and to pay attention to their state of health, and to go into self-isolation if symptoms occur.
Health professionals who had unprotected contact (professional or private) with a confirmed case  continue to work, always wear a surgical mask, ensure perfect hand hygiene and monitor their health.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines (valid from March 9th) for symptomatic persons and their contacts:
Persons with symptoms of an acute respiratory illness (fever and cough):
• Stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided (self-isolation)
• Only call a doctor if Your state of health requires this:
   - If the risk of complications is increased (particularly at risk) 
   - in case of dyspnoea
   - if respiratory symptoms worsen
Your close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) are instructed to pay attention to their state of health so that they can go into self-isolation as soon as they develop symptoms.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland issue new guidelines in relation to quarantine for COVID-19 cases.

If health condition allows it, positive cases have to isolate at home. Isolation ends 48 hours after symptoms disappear. 

If the case is severe, the patient will be hospitalized. The patient will return home whenever their state allows it and isolation ends 48 hours after symptoms disappear.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 10th, the Jura canton in Switzerland issued new guidelines in relation to quarantine for people who were in contact with confirmed COVID-19 cases.

The individuals must stay at home for 5 days from the onset of symptoms for the confirmed case. They must be wary of the state of their health and avoid contact with vulnerable populations.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The Cantonal Hospital of Nidwalden (Switzerland) announced a ban on visitors beginning on March 14, 10 AM. Exceptions may be granted on a case-to-case basis. UPDATE: On May 8 it was announced that hospitals and care facilities would prepare to re-open for visitors. description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines for dealing with confirmed cases from March 9, 2020 and an information sheet (March 7): What to do if you are infected with the new Coronavirus.
confirmed cases are isolated:
 • At home, if the general condition permits (self-isolation)
Removal of isolation: 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the onset of symptoms
 • In severe cases in the hospital:
 Return home as soon as the clinical condition permits, or removal of isolation in the hospital in accordance with the criteria listed above. UPDATE: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health released new guidelines for isolation of symptomatic persons and quarantine of contact persons.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases guidelines (valid from March 9th) for symptomatic persons and their contacts:
Persons with symptoms of an acute respiratory illness (fever and cough):
• Stay at home for up to 24 hours after the symptoms have subsided (self-isolation)
• Only call a doctor if Your state of health requires this:
   - If the risk of complications is increased (particularly at risk) 
   - in case of dyspnoea
   - if respiratory symptoms worsen
Your close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) are instructed to pay attention to their state of health so that they can go into self-isolation as soon as they develop symptoms.
 UPDATE: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health released new guidelines for isolation of symptomatic persons and quarantine of contact persons.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases recommendations ( valid from March 9th) for persons who had close contact with someone tested positive for the coronavirus.
Hospital doctors and doctors in private practice instruct the close contact persons (people living in the same household, intimate contacts) of the confirmed cases to stay at home for 5 days after the onset of symptoms (of the confirmed case) and to pay attention to their state of health, and to go into self-isolation if symptoms occur.
Health professionals who had unprotected contact with a confirmed case (professional or private) continue to work, always wear a surgical mask, ensure perfect hand hygiene and monitor their health. UPDATE: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health released new guidelines for isolation of symptomatic persons and quarantine of contact persons.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new guidelines how to deal with symptomatic persons ( Isolation): The sharp rise in COVID-19 cases in Switzerland increases the likelihood that a person with a respiratory disease has contracted the new coronavirus. Persons who have symptoms of an acute respiratory infection, which might be caused by the new coronavirus (SARS- CoV-2) or persons whose disease has been confirmed by laboratory diagnostics do not need to be hospitalized if their general condition is good. They must be isolated at home for at least 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the symptoms began.
This applies to persons with:  Cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, with or without fever, feverish feeling, muscle pain, whether tested or not.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On March 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases new self-quarantine guidelines for persons who have had contact with a sick person: If you live with, or have had an intimate relationship with, someone who has symptoms of acute respiratory disease, you must quarantine yourself at home for 10 days. Stay home for 10 days. The 10 days begin from the time the sick person is isolated. If after 10 days you have no symptoms, you can go public again. This applies if they had contact while the sick person was having symptoms and / or 24 hours before the symptoms appeared.      Monitor your health: Feeling unwell, tired, fever, feverish feeling, cough, sore throat and shortness of breath can be signs of infection with the new coronavirus, among other things.   If Symptoms Occur: Be in self-isolation and follow the instructions that apply to self-isolation.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On April 16, 2020 the Swiss Federal Office of Health releases a new information sheet for symptomatic persons ( Isolation): The increase in COVID-19 cases in Switzerland has increased the likelihood that a person with a respiratory disease has contracted the new coronavirus. You have symptoms of an acute respiratory infection and / or a sudden loss of smell and / or taste, which may be caused by the new coronavirus or the disease has been confirmed by laboratory diagnostics. If you do not have to be hospitalized as your general condition is good, you must immediately isolate yourself at home for at least 10 days.  End of isolation at home • 48 hours after the symptoms have subsided, provided that at least 10 days have passed since the symptoms began. If you have had a sudden loss of smell and taste: it may take longer for the smell and taste buds to recover. The isolation can therefore be lifted if the loss of the sense of smell and / or taste is the only symptom that persists after this time.
This applies to persons with:  sudden loss of smell / taste, cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, with or without fever, feverish feeling, muscle pain, whether tested or not.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
On July 1st, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided that from July 6th on all persons who enter Switzerland and who have been in a high risk country/ area within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days (at home / in another appropiate accommodation).They have to report  to the responsible cantonal authorities within 2 days. A negative test does not allow an exceptions. Quarantined persons are not entitled to loss of earnings compensation. Violation is fined.
Excepted are persons 
- who professionally transport people or goods across borders
- whose activity is absolutely necessary for the functionality of the health system, public security, international nstitutions
-  who have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in rail, bus, ship or air transport 
- who have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical necessities
- who have been less than 24h in a risk country (transit passengers)
- who just pass through Switzerland.
The FOPH has a list of the countries concerned, which it updates regularly: Argentina, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Bahrain, Belarus, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Dominican Rep, Honduras, Iraq, Israel, Cabo Verde, Qatar, Colombia, Kosovo, Kuwait, Moldova, N. Macedonia, Oman, Panama, Peru, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, Serbia, South Africa, Turks- / Caicos islands (UK), USA.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The list of risk countries was updated on July 23,2020 (announced July 17) by the Swiss FOPH. Since July 6 all incoming travelers having been in a risk country within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days at home / in an appropiate accomodation. A negative test does not allow an exception.They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight or bus services selected randomly. No loss of earnings compensation is provided. Violation is fined.
Excepted are persons who:
professionally transport people or goods across borders
whose activity is necessary for the functionality of the health system, public security or some international institutions
have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in transport 
have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical reasons

description:
The list of risk countries was updated on July 23,2020 (announced July 17) by the Swiss FOPH. Since July 6 all incoming travelers having been in a risk country within the last 14 days have to quarantine for 10 days at home / in an appropiate accomodation. A negative test does not allow an exception.They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight or bus services selected randomly. No loss of earnings compensation is provided. Violation is fined.
Excepted are persons who:
professionally transport people or goods across borders
whose activity is necessary for the functionality of the health system, public security or some international institutions
have stayed in a risk country in the course of their professional activity in companies involved in transport 
have to travel to Switzerland daily or up to 5 days for occupational or medical reasons
transit passengers

target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
In the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel starting 27th July 2020 exemptions 
regarding quarantine rules for health workers can be granted.This applies to the mandatory quarantine required after entering Switzerland from risk countries. These exemptions will be exceptional and granted on an individual basis. They primarily concern employees who cannot be replaced in the areas of health, safety or other professions. Granted on a case-by-case basis by the cantonal doctor, these requests can be made before the employee in question returns to Switzerland.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: On July 29, the Swiss Canton Grisons warns parents against the simple transmission of the virus. It is therefore strongly advised to keep children with symptoms such as runny nose, fever, cough, sore throat, etc. at home and to consult a doctor. Under no circumstances should children and young people take part in holiday and group offers - such as holiday camps, holiday passes or the like - if there are signs of illness. The policy aims to prevent other people from being infected.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 31 July, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that a participant at an equestrian event on 25 and 26 July has tested positive for corona. The announcement urges anyone with symptoms to quarantine themselves.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 2 August, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that a hockey player for SCB Future team tests positive for COVID-19. The entire team is placed in quarantine by the cantonal medical office.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Justice,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On August 6th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced federal and cantonal rules for quarantine for people returning abroad from countries deemed at risk (list on the website of the Swiss Confederation). Individuals must register their return from a risk country through a form and quarantine for a period of 10 days. Non-complying individuals will face up to 10000 francs of fine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 25 August, the canton Bern, Switzerland, announces the positive tests of three Asylumseekers and refugees in Huttwil. The canton says that 45 people associated with the Refugees have been put into Quarantine. One of the persons who tested positive also went to a class at the Rudolf-Steiner-Schule. Therefore, that class has also been placed under quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
The list of considered risk countries was updated on August 20, 2020 by the Swiss FOPH. As before all persons entering Switzerland coming from a risk country have to quarantine for 10 days, a negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation, but exempted they could not know in advance that their travel destination will be a risk area. They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Exempted are transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions.

description: The Swiss FOPH updated the list of considered risk countries on Sept 7, 2020 (announced Sept 4). Since July 6 all persons entering Switzerland coming from a risk country have to quarantine for 10 days  at home or another appropiate accomodation, a negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine. No loss of earnings compensation is provided.They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight or bus services selected randomly. Violation can be fined. Exempted are diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, in some international institutions. list of risk countries as of Sept 7 till Sept 13: Albania, Andorra, Argentina, Armenia, Aruba, Bahamas, Bahrain, Belize, Bolivia, Bosnia Herzegovina, Brazil, Cabo Verde, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Croatia, Dominican Rep, Ecuador, Faroe Islands, French Polynesia, Gibraltar, Guam, Guatemala, Guyana, Honduras, India, Iraq, Israel, Kosovo, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Maledives, Malta, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, Namibia, North Macedonia, Palestine, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Qatar, Romania, San Marino, Sint Maarten, South Africa, Spain  excl. description:
On Sept 11, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council decided on a new list of risk countries valid as of Sept 14. Travelers entering Switzerland having stayed in a risk country within the last 10! days have to quarantine for 10 days at home/suitable accomodation.They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight / bus services. Violation is fined. Except: professionals re-entering after participating in a sports-/ cultural event / specialist congress,diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health, security, international institutions.

Travelers coming from a risk country have to quarantine for 10 days at home/suitable accomodation.They have to report to the cantonal authorities carrying out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight/bus services.Violation is fined. Except:diplomats, transport professionals, transit,cross border commuter, professionals needed in health system, public security, international institutions and  professionals re-entering after participating in a sports/ cultural event/ congress
list: Albania, Andorra, Argentina, Armenia, Bahamas, Bahrain, Belgium, Belize, Bolivia, Bosnia Herzegovina, Brazil, Cabo Verde,Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica,Croatia, Czechia, Denmark, Dominican Rep., Ecuador, Guyana, Honduras, Hungary, Iceland, India,Iraq, Ireland, Israel, Jamaica, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Luxemburg, Maledives, Malta, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, Morocco, Namibia,Nepal, Netherlands, N. Macedonia, Palestine, Oman, Panama, Paraguay,Peru, Portugal, Qatar, Romania,Spain, Slovenia, Suriname, Trinidad/Tobago, Ukraine, UAE, UK, USA
Austrian areas: State Vienna,Lower Austria,Upper Austria
Italian areas:Liguria
French areas: Bretagne, Centre, Corsica, Hauts-de-France, Île de France, Normandie, Nouvelle-Aquitaine, Occitanie, Pays Loire, Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur, Guyana, Guadeloupe, Réunion, Martinique, Mayotte, French Polynesia,St Bathélemy,St Martin

description:
On Oct. 9, 2020 the list of risk countries (valid from Oct.12) was updated by the Swiss FOPH. As before all entering travelers having stayed in a risk country the last 10 days have to quarantine for 10 days (at home/accomodation).They have to report to the cantonal authorities. Violation is fined. Exemptions as before.
 risk countries Oct 12: Albania, Andorra, Argentina, Armenia, Bahamas, Bahrain, Belgium, Belize, Bosnia Herzegovina, Brazil, Canada, Cabo Verde, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Croatia, Czechia,Kingdom of Denmark, Ecuador, Georgia, Guyana, Honduras, Hungary, Iceland, India, Iran, Iraq, Ireland, Israel, Jamaica, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Luxemburg, Maledives, Malta, Moldova, Monaco, Montenegro, Morocco, Nepal, Kingdom of Netherlands, North Macedonia, Palestine, Oman, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Portugal, Qatar, Romania, Russia, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Tunisia, Ukraine, UAE, UK, USA.

description:
On Oct 28,2020 the Swiss Federal Council adapted the threshold for risk countries,only countries/areas with an incidence rate (new cases per 100.000 within 14 days) that is 60 higher than that in Switzerland will be placed on the list. The changes come into force on October 29. As before ( since July 6) all travelers having stayed in a risk country the last 10 days have to quarantine for 10 days at home/other accomodation. A negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine requirement. Quarantined persons do not get loss of earnings compensation (except change of list after departure).Travelers have to report to the cantonal authorites that carry out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight / bus services selected randomly. Violation is fined. Except: travelling for important business or medical reasons, professionals re-entering after participating in a sports/cultural event/specialist congress, diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers,cross border commuter, professionals needed in health, security, international institutions.
list of countries and areas as of October 29:
Andorra, Armenia, Belgium, Czech Republic 
Areas in France: Hauts-de-France, Île de France;  
Overseas territory of French Polynesia
The list is updated by the FOPH regularly.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Switzerland: The FOPH updated the list of risk countries as of November 23, 2020 (announced Nov 18). As before (since July 6) travelers entering Switzerland having stayed in a risk country within the last 10 days have to quarantine for 10 days at home or in a suitable accomodation. A negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine. No loss of earnings compensation is provided, except travellers could not know in advance that their travel destination will become a risk area.They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight and bus services. Violation is fined. 
Except: travelling on important business or medical reason, professionals re-entering after participating in a sports-/ cultural event / specialist congress,diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health, security, international institutions.
list of countries and areas as of November 23,2020:
Andorra, Czechia, Luxembourg, Montenegro  
French Oversea territory: French Polynesia
Austrian States: Salzburg, Upper Austria
The list is regularly updated by the FOPH.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On December 21, 2020, following the discovery of a new, more contagious variant of the coronavirus, the Swiss Federal Council decided that all persons who enter Switzerland from the United Kingdom or South Africa must go into quarantine for 10 days.This applies retrospectively since December 14. Every person who is required to quarantine must report to the competent cantonal authority within two days and follow the instructions issued by the relevant authority. Failing to comply with the mandatory quarantine is punishable by a fine of up to CHF 10,000. People who are already in the country have to start their quarantine by midnight on 21 December 2020 at the latest.The quarantine applies from the time of entry. In the case of visitors whose stay in accommodation has come to an end, visitors and accommodation providers must try to find a mutual solution if possible. Otherwise, the competent cantonal authority must provide accommodation. Airlines’ passenger data would be made available to the cantons that then have to control the quarantine. The FOPH informed tourist with a push message to their cell phones. Exceptions that are otherwise granted for quarantine of travelers do not apply to travelers from countries in which a virus mutant is spreading.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On January 12, 2021 the Swiss Federal Office of Health updated the list of risk countries, where a new, more contagious variant of the coronavirus is spreading. Ireland was added to the list, that previously included UK and South Africa. The new lists gets into force the same day January 12, 1 pm. As before all persons who enter Switzerland coming from those countries must go into quarantine for 10 days. Every person who is required to quarantine must report to the competent cantonal authority within two days and follow the instructions issued by the relevant authority. Failing to comply with the mandatory quarantine is punishable by a fine of up to CHF 10,000. Airlines’ passenger data would be made available to the cantons that then have to control the quarantine. Exceptions that are otherwise granted for quarantine of travelers do not apply to travelers from countries in which a virus mutant is spreading.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Swiss canton of Grisons announced that people who have already received two COVID vaccinations do not have to go through a two-week quarantine, even if they are entering the country from a high-risk area. People who can prove that they were infected with the virus at least three months previously are also exempt from quarantine. For travelers from South Africa and UK this exception is not applicable. This was an answer of the Grisons communication office on January 14, 2021.

description:
On January 6, 2021 the Swiss FOPH updated the list of risk countries. The updated list is valid as of January 15. As before (since July 6) travelers entering Switzerland having stayed in a risk country within the last 10 days have to quarantine for 10 days at home or in a suitable accomodation. A negative test result does not exempt from the mandatory quarantine. No loss of earnings compensation is provided, except travellers could not know in advance that their travel destination will become a risk area.They have to report to the cantonal authorities that carry out spot checks. Contact data are provided by flight and bus services. Violation is fined. 
Except:travelling on important business or medical reason, professionals re-entering after participating in a sports-/ cultural event / specialist congress,diplomats, transport professionals, transit passengers, cross border commuter, professionals needed in health, security, international institutions.
list of countries and areas (Jan 15 ,2021): Andorra, Croatia, Czechia, Denmark, Georgia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Montenegro, Netherlands, Panama, San Marino, Serbia, Slovenia, Sweden, USA  
Areas in Germany: Saxony
Areas in Italy: Veneto  
The list is regularly updated by the FOPH.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On January 21 , 2021 the Swiss Federal Office of Health updated the list of high- risk countries, where a new, more contagious variant of the coronavirus is spreading. (announced January 20). Brasil was added to list, that previously included the UK, South Africa and Ireland. The new lists gets into force  January 21, 1pm. As before all persons who enter Switzerland coming from those countries must go into quarantine for 10 days. Every person who is required to quarantine must report to the competent cantonal authority within two days and follow the instructions issued by the relevant authority. Failing to comply with the mandatory quarantine is punishable by a fine of up to CHF 10,000. Airlines’ passenger data would be made available to the cantons that then have to control the quarantine. Exceptions that are otherwise granted for quarantine of travelers do not apply to travelers from countries in which a virus mutant is spreading.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On March 1, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel Landschaft the Government Council ordered a temporary ban on serving drinks and food in Liestal and Sissach from March 1, 7 pm until the next day March 2, 2020 6 am. The permit for restaurants and bars for extended opening times (carnival) are cancelled. Selling of alcolhol is prohibited.
Non compliance can be fined.

description:
At its meeting on March 6th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the world of work: 
- Ensuring consistent compliance with personal hygiene measures (hand washing).
- Employees should, if operationally possible, keep their distance from one another e.g. by creating spatial adjustments, office splitting, teleworking / home office, etc. Masks are not recommended.
- Goodwill should apply when a doctor's certificate is requested. It should be requested from the 5th day at the earliest.
- Employers should make their employees' working hours as flexible as possible so that peak times in public transport can be avoided.
- Employees are to be informed of personal and workplace-related protective measures according to the current guidelines of the FOPH.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
At its meeting on March 6th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy and focused on protecting particularly vulnerable people. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the working world: Absence from the workplace i.e. home-office should be considered if no distancing or other temporary employment is possible for particularly vulnerable people who are exposed to an increased risk of infection in the workplace.
Risk factors are: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: At its meeting on March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. description:
On March, 14 2020, the Swiss canton of Ticino announces to close all bars, restaurants, pubs, agriturismo, gelaterie, huts and the like as well as all shops which are not selling essential products. Moreover, hairdressers, barbers, beauty salons and the like must close. The policy takes effect on March, 15 2020. 
On March,16 2020 the federal council of Switzerland announces to close restaurants, bars, discotheques, gyms, museums, cinemas, parks, ski resorts, businesses, hairdressers, beauty salons, tattoo studios, night clubs and libraries until April, 19 2020. Thus, the policy of Ticino announced on March, 14 is now covered by the federal policy.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the goverment council of Canton Basel Landschaft  announced that sales outlets that do not serve the maintenance of basic supply (such as food, pet food, medicines, medical aids, fuel) shall be closed starting March 16 till April 30.
Areas that do not serve the basic supply are to be demarcated from the permitted sales areas and closed. Restaurant and hotel businesses and all entertainment venues such as concert halls, cinemas, theaters, museums, sports facilities, fitness centers, swimming pools, discos, bars, nightclubs, erotic clubs, etc. will be required to cease operations.
Non compliance will be fined.

description:
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the State Council of Canton Valais announced the closure of following non- essential business starting the same day 6.30 pm:
- all food service establishments, including restaurants, pubs, ice cream parlors, tea rooms, farm vacations, mountain lodges and cabins, occasional opening breweries, bars (including those attached to bakeries, gas stations, train stations, hotels and campgrounds), with the exception of  delivery services/take- away and of non public canteens.
- stores, shops and markets to the public, except those selling food or goods for basic needs, medical and health items, as well as pharmacies, drugstores, opticians, kiosks and gas stations.
- hairdressers, barbers, beauty salons, nail salons, tattoo parlors - including those working at home
The announced hotel closure ( set to start March 17) was revoked when the federal council declared hotels to be essential on March 16 afternoon.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 15, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces the closure of shops and restaurants as of March 16 until April 30. Grocery stores, pharmacies, drug stores, banks and post offices can continue their activity. The government is calling on the population to reduce their mobility as much as possible. 
UPDATE: On March 16 the "Bundesrat", the national parliament of Switzerland announced the nationwide "extraordinary situation" (außergewöhnliche Lage). This also means that the cantonal measure gets replaced by a federal measure starting March 17, 2020.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 15th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the closure of all non-essential (walk-in) businesses, effective on March 16th.
Essential businesses are allowed to remain open and are defined as the following: any shop that mostly sells essential goods, gas stations and associated shops, kiosks, newsstands, pharmacies, drugstores, pharmacies, banks and post offices. 

Exceptions are the following:
Non-essential businesses that are closed are allowed to receive some clients with appointments. 
Restaurants, shops and institutions are allowed to produce and distribute food that is meant for take away or delivery.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the goverment council of Canton Basel Landschaft  announced that in retail outlets selling basic supply  (such as food, pet food, medicines, medical aids, fuel) and service establishments still open to the public, those responsible are required to ensure compliance with the hygiene rules of the FOPH and the social distance. The number of customers is to be limited to 1 person per 4 squaremeter net sales area. UPDATE: On March 17 the decision of the Government Council was repealed due to a change in the federal Covid19- ordinance 2  (starting March 17).

description:
On March 13, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Valais the State Council has decided to take the following additional measures:
the closure of cinemas, theaters, concert halls, discotheques, bars, night clubs, massage parlors, ski areas, sports halls, fitness centers, wellness centers, swimming pools and thermal pools, museums, media libraries, youth centers and other places of entertainment, culture and sports. UPDATE: On March 16, 2020 this policy was overruled by the federal closure of all non-essential business ( announced March 16), starting March 16 midnight, 12pm.

description:
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the State Council of Canton Valais announced the closure of following non- essential business starting the same day 6.30 pm:
- all food service establishments, including restaurants, pubs, ice cream parlors, tea rooms, farm vacations, mountain lodges and cabins, occasional opening breweries, bars (including those attached to bakeries, gas stations, train stations, hotels and campgrounds), with the exception of  delivery services/take- away and of non public canteens.
- stores, shops and markets to the public, except those selling food or goods for basic needs, medical and health items, as well as pharmacies, drugstores, opticians, kiosks and gas stations.
- hairdressers, barbers, beauty salons, nail salons, tattoo parlors - including those working at home
The announced hotel closure ( set to start March 17) was revoked when the federal council declared hotels to be essential on March 16 afternoon. UPDATE: This policy ended March 16, 2020 midnight 12 pm when it got overruled by the federal closure of all non- essential business.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 15, 2020 in Switzerland the goverment council of Canton Basel Landschaft  announced that sales outlets that do not serve the maintenance of basic supply (such as food, pet food, medicines, medical aids, fuel) shall be closed starting March 16 till April 30.
Areas that do not serve the basic supply are to be demarcated from the permitted sales areas and closed. Restaurant and hotel businesses and all entertainment venues such as concert halls, cinemas, theaters, museums, sports facilities, fitness centers, swimming pools, discos, bars, nightclubs, erotic clubs, etc. will be required to cease operations.
Non compliance will be fined.


 UPDATE: On March 17, this policy was suspended when the federal government closed non essential business by emergency ordinance, but allowed hotels to stay open. The cantonal council adopted its decision.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down_This type of business  ("${lm://Field/1}") is closed/locked down

description:
On March 15th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the closure of all non-essential (walk-in) businesses, effective on March 16th.
Essential businesses are allowed to remain open and are defined as the following: any shop that mostly sells essential goods, gas stations and associated shops, kiosks, newsstands, pharmacies, drugstores, pharmacies, banks and post offices. 

Exceptions are the following:
Non-essential businesses that are closed are allowed to receive some clients with appointments. 
Restaurants, shops and institutions are allowed to produce and distribute food that is meant for take away or delivery. UPDATE: On March 16th, the Swiss Federal council announced an extraordinary situation whereby all non-essential businesses must close by midnight on March 16th 2020 until April 19th. This policy supersedes the cantonal policy.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

The Swiss Federal council announces an extraordinary situation whereby all non-essential businesses must close by midnight on March 16th 2020 until April 19th. This policy was extended by one week till April 26th.
The Swiss federal council announced on April 16th a three-phase plan to re-open non-essential businesses starting on April 27th, followed by May 11th and ending on June 8th provided further decreasing case numbers.

description:
On March 16, 2020 at its extraordinary meeting the SwissFederal Council took the decision to introduce more stringent measures to protect the public. 
People at especially high risk should work from home. If that is not possible, they are to be placed on leave by their employers, but will continue to receive their pay. Employees make a personal statement about their particular risk. The employer can request a medical certificate.
risk factors issued by the FOPH are: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer UPDATE: First employees belonging to a vulnerable group should work from home. Now they have to work from home and if that is not possible, they are to be placed on leave by their employers,
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 15, the Swiss Canton Grisons announces the closure of shops and restaurants as of March 16 until April 30. Grocery stores, pharmacies, drug stores, banks and post offices can continue their activity. The government is calling on the population to reduce their mobility as much as possible. 
UPDATE: On March 16 the "Bundesrat", the national parliament of Switzerland announced the nationwide "extraordinary situation" (außergewöhnliche Lage). This also means that the cantonal measure gets replaced by a federal measure starting March 17, 2020. UPDATE: replaced by federal policy
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On 15th March 2020, the Swiss Canton of Neuchâtel ordered the closure of all businesses, except those providing essential goods and services, until 30th April 2020. On 16th March 2020, the Swiss Federal Council issued an order (effective 17th March 2020) that took over all cantonal measures, thus ending the original policy earlier than expected. UPDATE: The original closure of all non-essential businesses was set to last until 30th April 2020, but the Swiss Federal Council issued an order on 16th March 2020 (effective 17th March) that took over all cantonal measures, thus ending the original policy.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
At its meeting on March 6th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy and focused on protecting particularly vulnerable people. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the working world: Absence from the workplace i.e. home-office should be considered if no distancing or other temporary employment is possible for particularly vulnerable people who are exposed to an increased risk of infection in the workplace.
Risk factors are: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer UPDATE: On March 20, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council added exceptions to its measures to protect at risk employees effective March 21. If their work activities can only be performed at the usual place of work, employers are obliged to ensure compliance with the federal recommendations regarding hygiene and social distancing  by means of organizational and technical measures.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 1, the COVID-19 leadership body (KFO) of the Swiss Canton of Fribourg announced that the selling of seeds, saplings, and potting soil would be allowed under restrictions. These include to online-sales with delivery, drive-in systems with strict distancing and without causing traffic disruption, the closure of access to stores and greenhouses, mandatory orders in advance (online, via telephone or email), the avoidance of payments by cash, and the arrangement of exact timings to pick up the product. This measures eases the federal restriction of non-essential businesses from the 13 March 2020 due to the demand among the population.

description: On April 16, 2020, in light of corona restrictions being eased, the Swiss Federal Council releases new guidelines for protecting at-risk employees effective April 17. Employers have a duty to allow staff at especially high risk to work from home, if necessary by allowing them to perform appropriate alternative tasks. If it is imperative for an employee to be physically present, the employer must take steps to protect that person by adapting procedures or the working environment. If it is not possible for the person to work at home or at the workplace, the employer must place the employee on leave while continuing to pay their wages. Those risk factors issued by the FOPH are still: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer.

description:

The FOPH has issued recommendations for the working world: Absence from the workplace i.e. home-office should be considered if no distancing or other temporary employment is possible for particularly vulnerable people who are exposed to an increased risk of infection in the workplace.

description:
In Switzerland on April 16, 2020 the Federal Council announced that as of April 27 following non-essential business will be allowed to reopen:
personal grooming ( hairdresser, massage studios, tattoo studios); garden center, florists and nurseries; Do-it-yourself shops; self-service facilities ( car-washing, solarium, pick-your-own-crops).
All business have to follow a protection protocoll including hygienic measures, hand sanitation for customers, allowing social distancing. For personal grooming masks are obligatory, in shops not more than one customer per 10 qm is allowed.

description:
On April 29, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council announced the second step of easing business restrictions starting May 11. 
All shops, retail business and markets are allowed to reopen according to their protection concept ( one customers per 10 qm, compliance to the guidelines of the Federal Office of Health in regard of social distancing, hygiene).
Private museum and private libraries may open according to their protection concept.
Restaurants and bars can take the first step of resumption: only for seated consumption, groups of up to 4 per table, distance between tables, closure from midnight to 6 am, no live musik or events, masks recommended for employees

description: On April 9, the Swiss Canton of Fribourg allowed the re-opening of markt stalls in public places under the following conditions: The measure only concerns stalls that sell groceries, the distance between stalls in public places needs to be between 50-80 meters, the staff needs to ensure physical distancing of 2 meters in the queue, municipalities decide the days when market stalls are allowed while usual opening times can be extended to reduce the numbers of customers, municipalities need to ensure fair treatment of all merchants, and the cantonal police will be controlling. When these conditions apply, market stalls can only be opened in places where usually markets take place regularly. UPDATE: From March 11, 2020 onwards, following the federal decision, all kinds of markets are allowed to reopen under social distancing measures.

description: On May 12ve, 2020 the government council of Swiss canton Basel City is temporarily allowing Basel restaurateurs affected by the measures against the coronavirus to expand their existing outdoor seating. The expansion is possible immediately without a permit, as long as it meets the requirements (access for fire brigade, police...) and in particular the safety regulations. Expansions on the carriageway or on streets without sidewalks must be reported to the administration.The regulation applies until the distance rules are lifted due to the coronavirus, at the latest until November 15, 2020.

description: On April 16, 2020, in light of corona restrictions being eased, the Swiss Federal Council releases new guidelines for protecting at-risk employees effective April 17. Employers have a duty to allow staff at especially high risk to work from home, if necessary by allowing them to perform appropriate alternative tasks. If it is imperative for an employee to be physically present, the employer must take steps to protect that person by adapting procedures or the working environment. If it is not possible for the person to work at home or at the workplace, the employer must place the employee on leave while continuing to pay their wages. Those risk factors issued by the FOPH are still: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer. UPDATE: On May 12, 2020, starting May 15 the FOPH expands the categories of particularly vulnerable persons by another risk factor: obesity.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
On May 27, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council is easing most of the remaining business restrictions as of 6 June. 
All leisure and entertainment businesses such as casinos, amusement parks, cinema, theatre, discos may reopen, as can swimming pools and spas. Strip clubs may also reopen and services offered by sex workers may resume. Hygiene and social distancing rules must still be observed. If it is not possible to respect social distancing rules, contact tracing must be assured, e.g.by means of attendance lists.
For groups of more than four people restaurants it is required to take the contact details of one guest per table.Customers may still only be served when seated. All establishments, discos and nightclubs are required to close at midnight and may not admit more than 300 people a night. Discos are limited to one customer per 4 qm.
.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: On June 19, the Federal Council of Switzerland announces that from June 22 until September 13 operators of publicly accessible establishments and businesses such as restaurants, bars, clubs and discotheques and dance venues must draw up and implement a precautionary measures plan. It must include measures relating to hygiene and social distancing. The following persons are exempted from maintaining the required distance of 1,5m: groups of pupils, families or persons of the same household. Otherwise guests have to wear a mask or other effective protective measures must be taken, such as erecting suitable barriers. In the case of seats arranged in rows or in a similar way, in particular in theatres, concert halls and cinemas, only every second seat or seats separated by an equivalent distance may be occupied. The contact details of the persons present must be recorded if it is possible that they will be unable to maintain the required distance for a period in excess of 15 minutes and other protective measures are not in place. The contact details must on request be passed on to the competent cantonal authority or organization for the purpose of identifying and notifying persons who may have been infected. If over 300 persons and a maximum of 1000 persons are present, they must be split into groups of 300 persons per sector. Violation will be punished by fines.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On June 19, the Federal Council of Switzerland announces that from June 22 until September 13 operators of publicly accessible establishments and businesses such as restaurants, bars, clubs and discotheques and dance venues must draw up and implement a precautionary measures plan. It must include measures relating to hygiene and social distancing. The following persons are exempted from maintaining the required distance of 1,5m: groups of pupils, families or persons of the same household. Otherwise guests have to wear a mask or other effective protective measures must be taken, such as erecting suitable barriers. In the case of seats arranged in rows or in a similar way, in particular in theatres, concert halls and cinemas, only every second seat or seats separated by an equivalent distance may be occupied. The contact details of the persons present must be recorded if it is possible that they will be unable to maintain the required distance for a period in excess of 15 minutes and other protective measures are not in place. The contact details must on request be passed on to the competent cantonal authority or organization for the purpose of identifying and notifying persons who may have been infected. If over 300 persons and a maximum of 1000 persons are present, they must be split into groups of 300 persons per sector. Violation will be punished by fines.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Bars") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: With the start of the special situation in Switzerland as announced on June 19, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council implements preventive measures regarding employees effective June 22. It is said that employers must ensure compliance with the recommendations of the FOPH concerning hygiene and social distancing and therefore, must implement appropriate measures. If the required distance cannot be maintained, measures must be taken in accordance with the STOP principle (substitution, technical measures, organizational measures, personal protective equipment), i.e. home office, physical separation, separate teams or mask wearing.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 20 the Swiss Federal Council announces that in order to prevent the closure of construction sites and to offer better protection to employees, employers in the construction sector and industry are required to comply with the federal recommendations on hygiene and social distancing. Therefore, employers must limit the number of people present on construction sites or in other workplaces, and prevent groups of people from gathering in break rooms and canteens. The cantons may close down individual companies or construction sites if they do not comply. UPDATE: On June 19, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council has ended the exceptional situation in Switzerland and implements new, less stringent measures regarding employees in the construction sector and industry effective June 22.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Construction") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: At its meeting on March 6, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the working world, which should be implemented from March 9: Among other things, working from home i.e. home office is recommended so that all employees can keep their distance if operationally feasible. UPDATE: At its meeting on June 19, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council lifted its recommendation to work from home in light of persistently low Covid-19 caseloads. The decision as to whether staff should work from home or return to the office is now one for employers as of June 22.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On April 16, 2020, in light of corona restrictions being eased, the Swiss Federal Council releases new guidelines for protecting at-risk employees effective April 17. Employers have a duty to allow staff at especially high risk to work from home, if necessary by allowing them to perform appropriate alternative tasks. If it is imperative for an employee to be physically present, the employer must take steps to protect that person by adapting procedures or the working environment. If it is not possible for the person to work at home or at the workplace, the employer must place the employee on leave while continuing to pay their wages. Those risk factors issued by the FOPH are still: above 65 years of age, hypertension, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, chronic respiratory disease, an immune system weakened by disease or treatment, or cancer. UPDATE: On June 19, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council has ended the exceptional situation in Switzerland and implements new less stringend measures regarding at-risk employees effective June 22.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
At its meeting on March 6th, 2020 the Swiss Federal Council adjusted its strategy. The FOPH has issued recommendations for the world of work: 
- Ensuring consistent compliance with personal hygiene measures (hand washing).
- Employees should, if operationally possible, keep their distance from one another e.g. by creating spatial adjustments, office splitting, teleworking / home office, etc. Masks are not recommended.
- Goodwill should apply when a doctor's certificate is requested. It should be requested from the 5th day at the earliest.
- Employers should make their employees' working hours as flexible as possible so that peak times in public transport can be avoided.
- Employees are to be informed of personal and workplace-related protective measures according to the current guidelines of the FOPH. UPDATE: On June 19, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council has ended the exceptional situation in Switzerland and implements new less, stringent measures regarding employees effective June 22.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 3rd July 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel issued some recommendations for resuming activities after the summer break. The canton recommended that whenever possible, employers should implement remote working during one or two weeks for employees coming back from vacation. If this is impossible, it recommends that employers implement mask wearing during the same period of time for employees coming back from vacation. These measures aim at avoiding the spread of the virus after the summer break.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 3rd July 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel announced a measure related to contact tracing in bars and clubs. Bars and clubs managers have the obligation to formally identify their customers through an ID control or through an app that has been made available to the sector's professionals. This measure aims at ensuring the reliability of the contact information collected by bars and clubs and the proper functioning of contact tracing.

description: On Jun. 19, 2020 the Canton of Lucerne announced that they will tighten of the measures taken at federal level from Jun. 19 regarding the Contact Tracing measures in Clubs and Bars. Visitors to clubs and bars with dance facilities are required to identify themselves beyond doubt by means of an official ID card before being admitted to the premises. In addition, they are obliged to verify the cell phone number at least randomly and for at least 20% of the guests and to mark the verified numbers in the contact details. The information must be organized and managed in electronic form.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Bars") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On July 2nd, 2020 the government council of Swiss Canton Basel-City decided to hold the operators and organizers of facilities and events more accountable.They must now ensure the correctness of the collected visitor data by checking the identity card or in another way. A corresponding ordinance on additional measures will come into force on Monday, July 6, 2020 and will apply until December 31, 2020. 
This applies to all situation when according to the federal ordinance contact data are to be collected ( if  social distancing or the wearing of masks is not guaranteed), except for small groups sitting at one table in restaurants if the distance between the tables is large enough.
Non-compliance can be fined.
type_text: ensuring the correctness of visitors data collected by organizers of events to ease contact tracing
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On July 3, 2020 in Switzerland the Health Directorate of canton of Basel-Landschaft requires clubs and bars to verify the accuracy of the visitor data collected by means of control of the identity card starting July 6, 6pm untill further notice.
The decree applies to those catering establishments in which consumption regularly takes place at least partially standing, as seating is only available for a certain number of people, or in which there is the possibility of dancing ( clubs and bars).
It does not apply to restaurant establishments in which consumption is generally done while seated at a table.
Non - compliance can be fined and may lead to the closure of the establishment.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On July 8, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel Landschaft announced that starting July 9 till August 31 in clubs or bars where consumption does not take place exclusively in a seated position at a fixed seat, the maximum number of guests shall be limited to 100 persons. Several spatially separated guest areas with a maximum of 100 persons may be operated. The contact data ( in accordance with the federal Covid-19-Ordinance special situation) must be collected for each area individually. Outside these guest areas, if there is a possibility of mixing, either the minimum distance must be maintained or a protective mask must be worn. This applies to outdoor spaces as well.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On July 10, 2020 the canton of Bern, Switzerland, tightens the rules for registering guests to clubs and bars so that contact tracing is guaranteed in case of an infection. Business owners of bars, clubs, and dance halls, are required to report the name and address of their establishment to the cantonal medical office, including three additional contact persons. Before admission, guests are required to register with their full name, address, phone number, and email addresses with proof of identity. Business owners/contact persons must be available between 7-10am and ensure that the electronic guest list is sent to the cantonal medical office on request. This policy is supposed to end on November 1 2020.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Bars") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: In Switzerland, on July 10, 2020, the Canton Zug decided to add the following restrictions to the national measures effective July 13 until August 31: In the interiors of restaurants, bars and clubs as well as discotheques and dance halls, a maximum of 30 guests may be present. In the entire guest area, including any outdoor areas, a maximum of 100 guests may be present. The contact data must be recorded and verified with ID cards. Telephone numbers must be verified as well.

description: As of Tuesday July 28 in Geneva, Switzerland, customers must wear a mask in shops, as well as by staff when the latter cannot benefit from another protection system (eg glass or plexiglass). The managers of facilities and establishments open to the public must, from Tuesday July 28, 2020, provide their customers with a hydro-alcoholic solution. They must also ensure that no one enters their premises without prior disinfection of the hands. These measures will apply until October 1, 2020, with the possibility of being extended depending on the situation.

description: With the start of the special situation in Switzerland as announced on June 19, 2020, the Swiss Federal Council implements preventive measures regarding employees effective June 22. It is said that employers must ensure compliance with the recommendations of the FOPH concerning hygiene and social distancing and therefore, must implement appropriate measures. If the required distance cannot be maintained, measures must be taken in accordance with the STOP principle (substitution, technical measures, organizational measures, personal protective equipment), i.e. home office, physical separation, separate teams or mask wearing. UPDATE: On August 5, 2020, with immediate effect, the FOPH expanded the categories of particularly vulnerable persons by another risk factor: pregnancy.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 13 August, 2020, the canton of Bern, Switzerland, announces that beginning on 17 August, 2020, new measures will be implemented regarding contact tracing in restaurants. The new measures will oblige one guest per party to register their name, birthday, email address, and cell number. This measure is only relevant for guests seated inside the restaurant. It is not mandatory for outdoor guests.

description: On 19th August 2020, the Swiss canton of Neuchâtel announced that the maximum number of people allowed inside enclosed shops and art galleries will be limited to 1 person per 8m2 of floor space (staff included). Fines will be given to shop owners and art gallery owners who don't comply with the rules. Services that involve physical contact (such as hairdressers, spas, tattoo shops...) and places that involve sports activities are exempted from this policy. This measure comes into force on 21st August 2020 and will last until 30th September 2020.

description:
On July 8, 2020 in Switzerland Canton Basel Landschaft announced that starting July 9 till August 31 in clubs or bars where consumption does not take place exclusively in a seated position at a fixed seat, the maximum number of guests shall be limited to 100 persons. Several spatially separated guest areas with a maximum of 100 persons may be operated. The contact data ( in accordance with the federal Covid-19-Ordinance special situation) must be collected for each area individually. Outside these guest areas, if there is a possibility of mixing, either the minimum distance must be maintained or a protective mask must be worn. This applies to outdoor spaces as well.
 UPDATE: On August 17, 2020, the Canton of Basel-Landschaft announced the extension of the limit of the maximum number of customers in bars and clubs to 100 until September 30. (General decree no. 4).
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On July 10, 2020 the canton of Bern, Switzerland, tightens the rules for registering guests to clubs and bars so that contact tracing is guaranteed in case of an infection. Business owners of bars, clubs, and dance halls, are required to report the name and address of their establishment to the cantonal medical office, including three additional contact persons. Before admission, guests are required to register with their full name, address, phone number, and email addresses with proof of identity. Business owners/contact persons must be available between 7-10 am and ensure that the electronic guest list is sent to the cantonal medical office on request. This policy is supposed to end on November 1 2020. UPDATE: On October 1, 2020, a new national law takes effect that replaces this cantonal policy.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Bars") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
The Swiss federal government has voted for new measures to prevent the further spreading of the Corona virus. 
The new rules include: 
- Bars and restaurants have to close at 11pm. 
- Nightclubs have to close entirely. 
- Events with more then 50 participants are prohibited and cultural and sport events with more than 15 participants are prohibited. 
The measures are going to take effect on October 29, 2020.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 11th of December 2020, following the announcements made by the  Swiss Federal Council, the French-speaking cantons have once again come together in a desire for harmonization and clarity. The governments of the cantons of Vaud, Neuchâtel, Fribourg, Geneva and Jura have jointly decided to leave their restaurants open to allow evening service until 11 p.m. (10 p.m. for Valais). They salute and thank the Federal Council for listening and for the recognition of the work already undertaken in the fight against the pandemic.

description:
The Swiss Canton Saint Gallen announced that ski areas/resorts aren't allowed to open starting December 22, 2020. This decision was made depending on the epidemiological situation. Until this date ski areas are allowed to open when they have a safety concept that was submitted until December 11, 2020.
When the effective reproductive number falls below 1 and the situation in the hospitals relaxes, the ski resorts will reopen.

description: On July 9th, the Jura canton in Switzerland announced the strengthening of contact-tracing in the context of night clubs of the canton. Effective July 10th, this will be achieved through an app called Swiss Night Pass, which will record the participants, allowing for easy contact-tracing and number management in night clubs. UPDATE: On December 22nd, the Jura canton in Switzerland closed all bars and nightclubs effectively ending this policy.

description:
The Swiss Canton Saint Gallen announced that ski areas/resorts aren't allowed to open starting December 22, 2020. This decision was made depending on the epidemiological situation. Until this date ski areas are allowed to open when they have a safety concept that was submitted until December 11, 2020.
When the effective reproductive number falls below 1 and the situation in the hospitals relaxes, the ski resorts will reopen.
UPDATE: On December 30, 2020 the health department of Saint Gallen decided that ski resorts are allowed to open again starting on December 31, 2020. The decision to reopen was based on the epidemiological situation, if  the situation worsens,the reopening permission can be withdrawn. UPDATE: The ski ressorts will open again starting December 31,2020

description: The Swiss canton of Geneva has taken measures on March 4, 2020 to allow the counting of votes for the municipal elections and the first round of elections of land councillors, mayors and deputy mayors on March 15, 2020 at the Uni Mail despite Corona. However, access to the building will be limited to those who have an operational role in the counting of votes. The building will therefore be closed to the public and media representatives. Other logistical and organizational measures will be taken to organize the work in a way that limits the flow of people inside the building and avoids excessive concentration of people. Hygiene and protection rules will be reminded and bottles of disinfectant solution will be provided.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On March 16, 2020 in Switzerland the Council of State of canton Geneva has implemented the State's continuity plan, in which it has defined the priority state's services.
As a result, employees of the cantonal administration who do not provide a service considered as a priority no longer go to their place of work. Whenever possible, they carry out their activity from their home. If it is not possible to continue working at home, the staff members are obliged to remain at the employer's disposal. According to the corresponding decree as of March 16, 6 pm to March 29.
